in the math book, a 1-d vector don't use the same font as scalar though they are all lower case
the convention in math is that N=2 is capitalized, i've never considered N > 2 but presumably that would also be capitalized
it is an Array (a math matrix, basically) rather than a vector
From my experience variable names used in code almost neverhav much to do with the math counterparts.
pardon me, they're both Arrays, one in 2d, the other in 1d
if you're worried about confusing X for a class, i'm sure you'd be forgiven for calling it x... i was just trying to answer your question
i can start actually ending my sentences if periods if that would only deepen your madness.
sure, but this is Python, where there are other conventions
